revision.comment: [[User:Addbot|Bot:]] Removing Orphan Tag (Nolonger an Orphan) ([[User_talk:Addbot|Report Errors]])
revision.text:
{{MedalTableTop}} {{MedalCountry|{{CAN}}}} {{MedalSport | Women's [[Parachuting]]}} {{MedalWorldChampionships}} {{MedalSilver|[[1982 Skydiving World Championships|1982 Lucenec, Czechoslovakia]]|[[Accuracy landing|Team Accuracy]]}} {{MedalGold|[[1988 Skydiving World Championships|1988 Sweden]]|[[Accuracy landing|Individual Accuracy]]}} {{MedalBottom}} '''Lisa Olsen''' is a [[Canadian]]-[[United States|American]] [[skydiver]].
==Career== Olsen won the Gold Medal in Women's [[Accuracy landing|Individual Accuracy]] at the XIX World Parachuting Championships in [[Sweden]] in 1988.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cspa.ca/en/competition/canadian-wins-at-wpcs |title=Canadian Medal Winners at the Past WPC's |publisher=Canadian Sport Parachuting Association |accessdate=2011-05-14}}</ref> In 1982, Olsen, along with teammates [[Brenda Blue (skydiver)|Brenda Blue]], [[Kathy Kangas]], [[Eileen Vaughn]], and [[Bev Watson]], won the Silver Medal in Women's [[Accuracy landing|Team Accuracy]] at the XVI World Parachuting Championships in [[Czechoslovakia]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cspa.ca/en/competition/canadian-wins-at-wpcs |title=Canadian Medal Winners at the Past WPC's |publisher=Canadian Sport Parachuting Association |accessdate=2011-05-14}}</ref> after which they posed in bikinis in a 1982 issue of [[CANPARA]] ([[Canadian Parachutist]]).<ref> CANPARA Magazine, 1982</ref>
She later moved to the [[United States]] and finished eighth in the [[Skydiving#Hit and Rock|Hit'n'Rock]] competition at the [[Parachutists Over Phorty Society]] meet in [[Jordan]] in 1997.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thepops.org/world/w1997.php |title=Fourth World POPS meet June 3rd-9th 1997 - Aqaba, Jordan |publisher=Parachutists Over Phorty Society |accessdate=2011-05-14}}</ref> She also served as Chief Judge in [[Freefall style|Style]] & [[Accuracy landing|Accuracy]] at the 2004 US National Skydiving Championships.
== References == {{reflist}}
== External links == * [http://www.cspa.ca/en/competition/canadian-wins-at-wpcs Canadian Sport Parachuting Association] - Web page describing Lisa's individual and team medals at the World Parachuting Championships. * [http://www.thepops.org/world/w1997.php Parachutists Over Phorty Society] - Web page describing Lisa's placement in [[Skydiving#Hit and Rock|Hit'n'Rock]] at the 1997 POPS meet.
